2:30 AM thoughts with Ian: 2 things tonight. 1. It‚Äôs really nice to read back through a journal (ngl that‚Äôs most of why I‚Äôm up this late) and realize that all of the things you were worried about turned out fine. And it‚Äôs all good even tho you weren‚Äôt sure. That‚Äôs just a nice feeling. 2.  I‚Äôm probably not gonna go on a mission this summer. Since November, I‚Äôve been trying to pray to know for myself that like this is the true church and the book of morning is true and if I should go on a mission this summer or not, and I haven‚Äôt yet gotten like any definite responses. I talked to Bishop, and he said to just not go if you don‚Äôt get a specific witness for yourself to go, but I also emailed Ryker and both he and that guy who gave a devotional for both of our wards (can‚Äôt remember his name) recommended to just go for it and stop if you feel you should stop. But I can‚Äôt lie to Bishop and say I feel really strongly that I should go, even if I decided to just go for it, cause I seriously feel like I should not go on a mission at all. Idk man. But it‚Äôs kinda screwing up my plans and unless I get some strong feeling that seriously tells me to go on my mission by like March 1, I‚Äôm probably just gonna plan to sign up for fall semester and get some new housing. We‚Äôll see. I hope you enjoyed 2:30 am thoughts with Ian :)

You know, I actually really support you. I think my opinion really is that we need to have a testimony before we go through the temple and go on a mission. And if you feel you can‚Äôt answer those interview questions with confidence yet, then that‚Äôs okay. If you have even a desire to believe then you‚Äôre totally in the right place. Just don‚Äôt give up because I promise this all is true. I have worked hard for my testimony as well and I know you can feel it also. I also thought I‚Äôd tell you, I never got any strong feeling that I should serve a mission. It felt very much like my decision and so I‚Äôm just choosing to go :) and I know a lot of people I‚Äôve talked to are that way. I think also for you, if you develop a testimony of the church and of modern prophets, then you will feel their invitation for every able and willing young man to serve a mission truly apply to you and you will want to serve. So my advice is don‚Äôt worry so much about a mission, but focus first on those central pieces of the gospel and everything else will fall into place :)
